Description: Arrival mode to the ED (Ambulance, self-referral)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Attendance category (first ED attendance, unplanned follow-up)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Broad reason for the attendance (road accident, other accident, self-harm, sports injury, …)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Referral source for the patient (self-referral, GP, emergency services, police, …)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Incident location, where the patient is coming from (home, work, …)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Quintile of hospital bed occupancy on the day of the index attendance, relative to the yearly maximum attendance (taken as the max capacity)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, Admitted Patient Care

Description: High-dimensional fixed effect combining month, day of week and hospital
Source: Derived
Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Clinical Commissioning Group to which the ED belongs
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Number of ED attendances categorised as avoidable on the same day of the index attendance in the same ED
Source: Derived

Description: Number of ED attendances categorised as non-avoidable on the same day of the index attendance in the same ED
Source: Derived

Description: Dummy for the treatment condition of the NHS definition of avoidable attendance
Source: Derived

Description: Dummy for the investigations condition of the NHS definition of avoidable attendance
Source: Derived

Description: Dummy for the discharge condition of the NHS definition of avoidable attendance
Source: Derived

Description: Dummy for the arrival mode condition of the NHS definition of avoidable attendance
Source: Derived

Description: Waiting time between arrival and initial assessment
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Waiting time between initial assessment and start of treatment (for those treated)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Waiting time between arrival and discharge
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the target of 4hr for total attendance time was breached for the patient
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Amount reimbursed to the ED for the attendance based on HRG tariffs
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Number of investigations conducted during the attendance (if has not left before initial assessment)
Source: Derived from the treatments recorded in HES A&E

Description: Number of treatments conducted during the attendance (for those treated)
Source: Derived from the treatments recorded in HES A&E

Description: Whether the patient has left before being treated or refused treatment
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient has been admitted to an inpatient department as a result of the attendance
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient was discharged without follow-up
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient has been discharged with a GP follow-up
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient was referred to an outpatient clinic or a lower level ED
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient was referred to any other type of provider
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient had another ED attendance within 7 days
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Whether the patient died within 30 days of attending the ED
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E
Derived from patient's age and gender

Description: Ethnic background (according to Office for National Statistics)
Source: Hospital Episodes Statistics, A&E

Description: Quintile of income-component of the index of multiple deprivation (IMD) of the patient's lower super-output area (LSOA) of residence
Source: UK Government website

Description: Primary ED diagnosis recorded at attendance. Primary ED diagnoses can differ from the inpatient ICD-10 code recorded for admitted patient, the latter being more accurate.
